Summarize the following plan for our community at Bloom.pm and offer critiques for where you see holes in the plan:
'
Background
A quick recap of what happened in the past month and half:
We launched a survey to understand people’s interests
We ran an async open program on Growth Hacking
We organized a live pre-training session for the closing of the Growth Hacking challenge
We organized a live training workshop as a closing event for the growth Hacking challenge.

Lessons learned:
Live sessions are needed to have better engagement
We need to leverage our facilitation skills
We need to include more the founders (Munir and Bilal) in terms of having them as 
We need to have some kind of incentives
We need to better understand our audience and what we want to achieve with each type of audience.

Therefore, we identified the need to understand our audience better, which led to the below full-scale study of whom to target, why, and how?

The Open Community Plan is divided into the following sections:
Target audience (personas)
Suggested activities/programs (for each persona)
Incentives
Communication channels
Partners
Timeline
Execution plan & roles

In this meeting, we need to do the following:
Have quick general comments on all the sections of the plan
Agree on our target audience
Decide which activities/programs are bringing the best value and are feasible to do
Next step: I need to do some further research and reading, and based on all of that combined, I will be able to work on a final execution plan.
Target Audience (personas)
Here is a list of the different personas that would make sense for us to target and nurture as an open community, including examples of our current audience.

University Students 
Lebanon: AUB, LU
Aspiring entrepreneurs
Women entrepreneurs 
HMN teams who didn’t make it to the accelerator
Rural entrepreneurs
Part of the HMN teams who didn’t make it to the accelerator
Urban entrepreneurs 
A large number of people in our newsletter
Established entrepreneurs
Our alumni
LGA / Part of ACSI / Part of HMN
Family business owners
To Be Defined
Growth-stage entrepreneurs 
Part of our newsletter subscribers
University professors
To Be Defined
Trainers
To Be Defined
Investors
To Be Defined

This table breaks down the needs and interests of each persona we want to target. This helped me better shape the activities and the ideas we want to do for each segment.
Suggested Activities / Programs
University Students 
Present Like a Pro: Master Your Communication Skills!
A month-long program, launched at an in-person meeting at their campus, followed by weekly online sessions. The work is based on our assessments and library and facilitated by us. No need for trainers. Bilal and Munir can play a nice role by sharing their expertise. Incentive: Certificate of participation, Final contest winner, Bloom gear gift. Winners get to participate in a TOT.
Pass the torch program!
We support the winners in the above program to organize programs for others, relying on our resources and our guidance. We can run a quick TOT for them to give them a boost at the start. Munir would play a central role in the TOT. Incentive: highlighting them and their impact as a success story in a blog post on our website.
Aspiring entrepreneurs
Women entrepreneurs 
Monthly Learning Challenge
A month-long program. The topic is chosen based on this specific audience and promoted as such. Promoted online and through partner organizations focusing on women's empowerment. We run it online with the possibility to launch it at the premises of a women-focused organization. Incentive: TBD
Nurturing Positive Daily Habits
This program is focused on starting the month with a workshop highlighting the Bloom Calendar and then keep connecting async to encourage each other on daily basis. Probably best done on WhatsApp. Bilal would be the main figure for this workshop. Incentive: TBD
Weekly Co-working (Pomodoro focus sessions)
People join these sessions to really augment their chances to finish stuff they have been procrastinating on. The facilitation of these sessions should be designed such as people would really finish stuff. Munir can play a nice role in here as well as finish some pending stuff too :)
Rural entrepreneurs
Lebanon Revealed: A Series of Discoveries.
We support Rural Entrepreneurs to organize hiking, biking, or any kind of fun event that would highlight the village they come from. This would be a great networking opportunity for them and a nice break for urban and established entrepreneurs. Incentive: During this day there is a pause to do a collective intelligence exercise for the entrepreneur organizing the day. Bloom gear gift.
Monthly Learning Challenge 
The topic is chosen based on this specific audience and promoted as such. Incentive: TBD
Nurturing Positive Daily Habits
Same description as before Incentive: TBD
Urban entrepreneurs 
Monthly Learning Challenge
The topic is chosen based on this specific audience and promoted as such. Incentive: TBD
Nurturing Positive Daily Habits
Same description as before Incentive: TBD
Established entrepreneurs
Our alumni (who have been on the market for more than 4 yrs)
Share your human resource & save cost initiative
We create a category on our community where teams can add free team members able to work on other projects including the fees and the available duration. Other people can just contact them directly and have the person work for example one day a week for the other team for a specific period of time.
TOT training to become mentors
We organize two or three times a year a several days workshop to train people on how to be good mentors. I assume a lot of our alumni would be interested.
Workshop on who to write blogs and build an expert profile in your domain
We don’t have content ready for this, and we even don't have someone who could support them on that. But definitely, it is something very valuable to anyone who wants to have a strong presence on the market.
Experts meetings
Topic to be discussed
Panel Discussion
Topic to be discussed
Family business owners


Growth-stage entrepreneurs 


University professors


Trainers


Investors


Incentives
Some incentives are mentioned above in each suggested activity, we are adding all the ideas here in order to consolidate the list.
Bloom gear
Using our office for meetings/workshops/co-working/mingling 
Bloom media blitz (highlighting for a week on all our media channels a specific enterprise/product/service) 
Using our tech tools (Zoom, what else?)
Bloom surgical intervention (meeting with four Bloom team members for four hours: one from comms, one from the program team, one from ops team, and one from learning and creativity team)
Free babysitting for teams who have kids.

Summary:

The Open Community Plan at Bloom.pm aims to improve engagement by targeting and nurturing specific audience personas and offering tailored activities, incentives, and communication channels. The plan is divided into sections, including target audience, suggested activities/programs, incentives, communication channels, partners, timeline, and execution plan & roles. The target audience consists of university students, aspiring entrepreneurs, women entrepreneurs, rural and urban entrepreneurs, established entrepreneurs, family business owners, growth-stage entrepreneurs, university professors, trainers, and investors. For each persona, various activities and programs are suggested, along with potential incentives and communication channels.

Critiques:

1. Lack of clear goals and objectives: The plan lacks a clear statement of what the community aims to achieve through these activities and programs. It is crucial to define specific goals and objectives for each target audience to measure the success and impact of the activities.
